meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to catch fire or ignite.
meanings.sent1: The ignitability of the dry leaves made the forest highly flammable.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters were concerned about the ignitability of the old building.
meanings.sent3: The ignitability of the birthday candles caused a funny mishap at the party.
meanings.sent4: His temper had an ignitability that could spark arguments in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The ignitability of the fireworks lit up the night sky with colorful bursts.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily set on fire.
meanings.sent1: The material's high ignitability posed a danger in the laboratory.
meanings.sent2: Campers should be cautious of the ignitability of dry brush in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The ignitability of the campfire wood made for a quick and cozy evening.
meanings.sent4: The ignitability of the match was crucial for starting the bonfire.
meanings.sent5: The ignitability of the gasoline made it a risky substance to handle.
